Scroll down to find out what to do

What to do

  1. Upload your photo for your ID card.

    Available August 1st

    To avoid queuing on campus during welcome week upload your own photo by the 1st of September and your card will be ready for collection following your course induction event.

    The photo upload functionality is currently not available.

    Important notice

    If you do not upload your photo within the dates specified, you’ll need to visit the registry office from Monday 24 September for your student card.

       Upload your photo 

  2. Complete online enrolment

      Enrol online

  3. Induction sessions

    Ensure you attend your induction sessions.

      View induction sessions

  4. Admissions Documents

    Bring along all essential documents to your admissions check-in.

    Important notice

    Please contact the admissions team at Ulster University to complete your document checks.
    You cannot enrol until your documents have been checked.

      View the document list

    • NI, GB and EU Students
    • International students

    NI, GB and EU Students

    What to bring to your Admissions Check-in

    You will require the following documentation:

    1. Photographic ID (e.g. Passport or Driving Licence)
    2. Documentary evidence of all examinations taken from GCSE Level (or equivalent) onwards if not already provided to the University.

      You will not be able to enrol online until this information has been provided.

      You can also email admissions@ulster.ac.uk with copies of your qualifications. Please include your UCAS ID when providing this.

    3. If not already enrolled, you will need to bring payment for fees; or acceptable evidence that fees will be paid by an education authority or sponsor.

    Normally if you are enrolling on a postgraduate course (with the exception of PGCE courses), you will only be required to produce evidence relating to your primary degree (unless otherwise specifically requested by the University).

    International students

    Tier 4 students

    You must bring:

    1. Your passport
    2. Your CAS statement
    3. Your academic qualification/s (this is listed in the “Documents Used to Obtain Offer” section of your CAS statement)
    4. Your English language qualification (e.g. IELTS certificate, WAEC certificate, Indian XII certificate)

    You may also need to bring:

    1. Evidence of the date on which you arrived in the UK (this could be a copy of your boarding pass or travel ticket)*
    2. Evidence from the UK Home Office that you have a Tier 4 visa application in progress**

    * This is only needed if you entered the UK through the eGates or if you did not receive an entry stamp in your passport when you went through immigration control in the UK.

    ** This is only needed if you have submitted an application for Tier 4 Further Leave to Remain in the UK and you have not yet received your Tier 4 visa for studying at Ulster University

    Other International students

    You must bring:

    1. Your passport
    2. Your BRP or other evidence of your UK immigration status (if applicable)

    You may also need to bring:

    1. Evidence of the date on which you arrived in the UK (this could be a copy of your boarding pass or travel ticket)*

    * This is only needed if you entered the UK through the eGates or if you did not receive an entry stamp in your passport when you went through immigration control in the UK.

    You will not be permitted to complete your registration if you do not bring these documents to registration.

  5. International Induction Sessions

    Ensure you attend your induction sessions.

      View sessions

  6. Know your way around

    Familiarise yourself with your campus location.

      View campus information

Induction sessions

These induction events are compulsory and will provide valuable information regarding your course.

You will need to bring photographic identification and evidence of the qualifications you have received.

Event Date Time Location
Provost Welcome Monday 16 September 9:00 AM Assembly Hall
Department and Course Induction Monday 16 September 9:15 AM 3G06, 3G05, 3E03
Cohort and Staff Socialisation Monday 16 September 10:15 AM 3G06, 3G05, 3E03
Enrolment Forms and Module Selection with your Course Director Monday 16 September 11:15 AM 3G06, 3G05, 3E03
Online Enrolment and Student Finance Monday 16 September 12:15 PM Library
Admissions Check Monday 16 September 2:00 PM Library

Free Microsoft Office Software

As an Ulster University student, you can download the latest version of the Microsoft Office suite free of charge. You can do this once registered. You can also ensure your computer is protected against viruses and threats with McAfee Anti-virus software.

Medical registrations

Ulster University strongly advises all our students to register with a local doctor (GP) & have the relevant travel/ medical insurance.

  Find your nearest doctor (GP)

Meningitis Vaccine

Ensure you have your Men ACWY vaccine before coming to uni. As a fresher you are in a high risk group, particularly in the first few weeks of term.

  Find out more
